title: Switching from developer to product owner? Consider these pros and cons first
content:
Career progression is important. After all, it’s what motivates us, keeps us engaged, and ultimately helps us to move up the career ladder. For many developers, becoming a product owner is seen as the ultimate goal. But, it’s not for everyone. When working in agile teams, you can’t be a product owner and a developer i.e. a member of the team. This is because it goes against one of the key principles of scrum, commitment. So, at some stage in your career, you’ll probably have to make a choice. Would you like to make the switch to product owner or…

This story continues at The Next Web
description: Many developers have made the switch from product developer to product owner, but is it right for you? Here's what you need to know.
